CatDescriptText: The huge campaign headquarters sign above the storefront windows reads, "Republican & Democratic Voters, 3th Ward, for Wm. S. Howell for City Controller".  The storefront window advertises the business as being the Uptown Smoke Shop.  Campaign posters on the building read, "Duggan is the Man for Your Next District Attorney, Robert W. Duggan, Vote Republican!" and "For People and Progress, For Supreme Court - J. Colvin Wright, Harold L. Ervin;    For Common Please Court - Loran L. Lewis, Arthur  Wessel, Jr., Albert A. Flok, Walter A. Smart, Gwilym A. Price, Jr., John P. Hester, Anne X. Alpern;    For County Court - Benjamin Lencher, Charles D. McCarthy;   For District Attorney - Robert W. Duggan;   For County Controller - Walter J. Williams;   For Registrar of Wills - Alice Dobson Tobias;   For Orphans Court - Hugh C. Boyle;   For County Commissioner -  Blair F. Gunther, John M. Walker;  For County Treasurer - John A. Hollingsworth;   For Prothonotary - Samuel L. Sherman;  For Recorder of Deeds William John Adams;   For City of Pittsburgh Office - City Controller - William S. Howell;   For City Council - Joseph M. Beatty, Robert F. Kanaley, Jerome J. Brozen[?], August R. Madera[?];   Special Elections - For Representatives in the General Assembly - Charles J. Conaway, Vote Straight Republican:.
TitMainTitle: Exterior view of campaign headquarters for William S. Howell, 3rd Ward, street no. 72, with man standing in front of building, with campaign posters in background
